page.title: 02TRANSPORT IN COLERAINE
page.content: The port of{Coleraine}in the past reflected the importance of the region.Its growth, however, was restricted by the physical limitations of the river Bann,which is now regularly dredged to facilitate the passage of large vessels to the harbour.Today the Port, although small in national terms, retains a significant role as an importer of two main items of trade for its hinterland, and two raw materials for industry. The first two are{coal and timber. The coal is mainly imported from England and Wales.During the miners' strike of 1984/85 some coal was imported from Poland. This coal was found by many users to be inferior to English coal.
